snippet: The owners of the Red Hook Lobster Pound debated whether to take the opportunity after Hurricane Sandy to rebuild on a grander scale, and add a deep fryer.
abstract: Brooklyn food merchants trounced by Hurricane Sandy, from restaurant owners to food truck vendors, are in the midst of deciding whether to rebuild their businesses quickly and get back to business, or to take the time to gather finances and make plans for improving and expanding; Red Hook Lobster Pound in Brooklyn is offered as a prime example of the quandry.
lead_paragraph: The owners of the Red Hook Lobster Pound debated whether to take the opportunity after Hurricane Sandy to rebuild on a grander scale, and add a deep fryer.

headline.print_headline: Merchants’ Quandary: Rebuild Quickly, or Improve?
headline.seo: Red Hook Lobster Pound Sees Opportunity in Rebuilding After Hurricane
headline.main: Merchants’ Quandary: Rebuild Quickly, or Improve?
headline.kicker: Coming Back | Red Hook Lobster Pound
